multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a very itchy rash on my upper back.
How long have you had this rash?
I've had the rash for about 1 year.
Has the rash spread to other parts of your body?
No, the rash has not spread to other parts of my body.
Does the rash appear as reddish patches with silvery scales?
No, the rash appears as a slightly darkened circular area.
Do you remember any specific event or condition, such as a bug bite or contact with plants, that started before the rash appeared?
No, I don't recall any specific event or condition that started before the rash appeared.
Do you have any known allergies or a family history of skin conditions?
No, I don't have any known allergies or a family history of skin conditions.
Is the affected area of the rash dry or does it have a clear border separating it from the normal skin?
The affected area has a clear border separating it from the normal skin.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for the rash, and if so, did they have any effect?
No, I have not tried any treatments or medications for the rash.
Final Diagnosis: Tinea Versicolor
